ai.summary: A short, easy 1.1 km section of the North Downs Way Link Path in the UK, ideal for a quick stroll or family outing.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily flat, well-maintained footpath along rural lanes with hedgerows. Surfaces are typically firm (tarmac or compact gravel) with occasional gentle slopes.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather and daylight before you go. Wear sturdy, comfortable footwear suitable for potential mud. Stay on marked paths and follow waymarkers. Carry water, a light layer, and a charged phone. Be mindful of traffic on road sections and plan for daylight hours; in winter, shorter days may limit access. If with children or pets, keep them close and carry a whistle for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device / smartphone with offline map
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and autumn. Summer can be comfortable; winter visits may be muddy and daylight-limited.

seo.title: North Downs Way Link Path – Easy 1.1 km Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Explore an easy 1.1 km section of the North Downs Way Link Path in the UK. Quick terrain overview, safety tips, and gear checklist for a short, scenic hike.
